The Best Rich and Moist Chocolate Cake

ByJennifer @ Plowing Through Life January 21, 2023May 8, 2024
154 Comments

This post may contain affiliate links. Please read my disclosure policy.

Jump to Recipe

This Easy Chocolate Cake Recipe from a box mix is professional bakery-quality, but anyone can make it at home with simple ingredients.

Our family recipe adds sour cream, instant pudding, extra eggs and chocolate chips to make a box of cake mix so much more moist and delicious!

Easy Chocolate Box Cake Recipe

This is a bakery-quality cake recipe that anyone can make at home with common ingredients!

This chocolate cake is super moist because it is made with pudding and sour cream.  A cup and a half (or the whole bag) of semi-sweet chocolate chips add to the rich flavor.  The combination of all of these ingredients is truly unforgettable and very popular on Pinterest and TikTok, just like our Easy Chicken Cobbler.

When I’m craving a delicious dessert this is our go to for a super easy chocolate box cake recipe.  Not knowing what to name it we say it’s the BEST rich and moist chocolate cake from a box mix, and love sharing that is unbelievably EASY to make! 

Save this Recipe
Please enable JavaScript in your browser to complete this form.

Enter your email and I’ll send this recipe right to your inbox! Plus, I’ll send you new recipes every week!

We typically use a can of frosting, but check out the Chocolate Cool Whip Frosting on our Chocolate Poke Cake to put a spin on this recipe.

A Moist Cake With Pudding Mix Added

A popular birthday cake, this is a secret recipe that was stolen from my mother-in-law’s kitchen.  She was sworn never to give the recipe away, to never let people know about the instant pudding and sour cream that are added in.  Being a woman of her word she didn’t. 

I hope I never forget the day my husband was looking for something in the kitchen and he found this recipe. 

We couldn’t tell her for the longest time that we had the family favorite recipe.  Then a few years passed and the small town restaurant that supposedly shared the recipe closed, so I think it’s safe to share with you.

Adding instant pudding creates a wonderful dessert with very little effort.  

Our Easy Triple Chocolate Fudge Cake, White Chocolate Cupcakes, and Chocolate Covered Strawberry Cake were all inspired from this method and recipe.

Ingredients Needed:

A few simple ingredients elevates a box mix of cake to taste homemade in about 15 minutes!

  • Box of Devil’s Food Cake Mix – or another type of chocolate cake mix will work fine too
  • Instant Chocolate Pudding – only instant pudding will do, make sure not to buy the cook and serve type
  • Eggs – adding more eggs than a typical box mix calls for helps tenderize every morsel of cake
  • Sour Cream – makes the cake have a deeper flavor and adds so much moisture
  • Warm Water – helps activate the pudding and allows all of the ingredients to mix together
  • Vegetable Oil – adds fat and moisture for tender crumbs
  • Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips – more chocolate flavor makes the cake even better

The Best Chocolate Birthday Cake

This cake is almost always requested at family birthday parties.  And Joe comes from a big family so there’s a lot of birthday parties which means a lot of the best chocolate cake ever!

Faith, family, farming and food are big in my husband’s family.  All the prerequisites for a great relationship!  I’m so grateful for the values that Joe’s family has instilled in him.  He has carried these values into our family and our marriage!

Simple family traditions and big parties are so valuable. Part of feeding a crowd on a budget has included learning how to make box cake better.

My husband just said this week (in January) that he would like to get marinated pork chops or ham loaf from a local market for his birthday in April.  Cheers to the time and effort to create traditions that are special.

Tips for Making Box Cake Better

  • Mix ingredients very well before adding chocolate chips
  • Be careful not to add liquids to pudding mix only as it can begin to set up like pudding
  • The pudding makes this cake so moist, but it also means the cake takes longer than normal to bake
  • Baking times vary, so I use a toothpick to test the cake a couple times to prevent burning
  • After removing cake from the oven cover with a piece of foil to help hold in ALL of the moisture – this is key to keeping a super moist cake
  • Cake can be made in two 9 inch pans or in a 9 x 13-inch pan
  • I always use 1 1/2 to 2 cans of chocolate store bought icing to save time, but feel free to make homemade icing
  • My husband loves this cake with a couple cans of cream cheese icing too

Easy Add Ins To Make A Box Cake Better

  • Eggs – makes the cake richer
  • Pudding Mix – adds sweetness and improves the texture to be softer and more enjoyable
  • Sour Cream – adds so much richness and helps make the cake super moist
  • Semi-sweet Chocolate Chips – more chocolate makes it sweeter, more chocolatier and even more like a professional cake
  • Coffee – substitute coffee in place of the warm water as it amplifies the chocolate flavor

How to Make Moist Chocolate Cake

  1. Preheat oven to 350ºF. Grease a 9 x 13-inch pan; 2 – 9 inch round pans also work well.
  2. Mix all ingredients except chocolate chips on medium speed for up to 1 minute.
  3. Gently fold in chips and pour into greased pan.
  4. Bake for 30 – 40 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

Step By Step Instructions

Preheat oven to 350ºF and coat a 9 x 13″ pan with non-stick cooking spray.

In a large electric mixing bowl pour in box of cake mix.

Break eggs and add to bowl. Add sour cream, vegetable oil and warm water.

Then add the instant chocolate pudding mix and be ready to mix fairly quickly.

You don’t have to race, but you don’t want to wait and let the pudding set up.

Begin mixing.

Then scrape the sides of the bowl with a spatula.

Mix for about a minute, but be careful not to over mix.

Then lift the beater and clean it off with the spatula.

Remove the bowl from the base and add chocolate chips.

Use spatula and fold in by hand.

Pour cake batter into a greased baking dish.

Bake uncovered for 35 to 40 minutes until a tooth pick inserted in the center comes out clean.

Allow cake to cook and then cover with icing. We typically use one to one and a half cans of chocolate or cream cheese frosting.

Storage Instructions

Store covered in a container with a lid or covered tightly with foil to keep moist. Keep on the counter for 3 – 4 days.

Storing in the refrigerator helps extend the life of the cake up to a week.

More of our Favorite Cake Recipes:

Here are a few other of our favorite cake recipes to make for birthdays, special occasions and everyday desserts.  We hope you enjoy these cakes as much as we do!

  • Oreo Dirt Cake

The Best Rich and Moist Chocolate Cake

Servings 15 pieces
Author: Jennifer
This Easy Chocolate Cake Recipe from a box mix is professional bakery-quality, but anyone can make it at home with simple ingredients.
4.85 from 40 votes
Print Recipe Pin Recipe Rate this Recipe
Prep Time 10 minutes mins
Cook Time 35 minutes mins
Total Time 45 minutes mins

Equipment

  • Silicone Spatula
  • White Baking Dish
  • Stand Mixer

Ingredients
  

  • 1 box Devil’s food cake mix
  • 3.4 ounce package instant chocolate pudding
  • 4 large eggs
  • 1 cup sour cream
  • 1/2 cup warm water
  • 1/2 cup vegetable oil
  • 1 1/2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
Prevent your screen from going dark

Instructions
 

  • Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9 x 13 inch pan.
  • Mix all ingredients except chocolate chips at medium speed for 2 minutes.
    1 box Devil’s food cake mix, 3.4 ounce package instant chocolate pudding, 4 large eggs, 1 cup sour cream, 1/2 cup warm water, 1/2 cup vegetable oil
  • Gently fold in chips.
    1 1/2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
  • I always use a 9 x 13 pan, by 2 – 9 inch round pans can also be used.  Bake for 30 – 40 minutes until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

Notes

  • Mix ingredients very well before adding chocolate chips
  • Be careful not to add liquids to pudding mix only as it can begin to set up like pudding
  • The pudding makes this cake so moist, but it also means the cake takes longer than normal to bake
  • Baking times vary, so I use a toothpick to test the cake a couple times to prevent burning
  • Cake can be made in two 9 inch pans or in a 9 x 13-inch pan
  • I always use 1 1/2 to 2 cans of store bought icing to save time, but feel free to make homemade icing

  37. GiniD says:
    at


    For any cake mix, I always substitute milk for the water, and butter for the oil, in addition to a box of instant pudding in the same flavor of the cake. Always use 4 eggs, and all ingredients should be at room temperature – I let mine sit out for about 45 minutes. Your cake will be very, very moist and rich! Also, you can heat your tub of icing in the microwave for about 15 seconds — makes it so much easier to spread.

    Thanks!
    Gini

  55. Barbara says:
    at

    I made this cake twice. It is wonderful! But the second time I made it, it fell a little more and wasnt that high in my 9×13 pan. What did I do wrong?

    Reply
    1. Jennifer @ Plowing Through Life says:
      at

      Hey There! Great question – I did adjust the recipe to read mix at medium speed for 2 minutes, because over mixing can cause a cake to go flat among many other things. Letting heat out of the oven too early in the baking process or leaving out an ingredient are other options. I’m glad you know how great the recipe can taste and I hope you’ll try it again! Thanks for checking out our recipes

    Overall I think the cake tasted good. I followed the recipe but I accidentally underbaked it. Its important to test the cake with a toothpick because the cake can look like its done but then fall. I thought that the cake was delicious but it needed to be baked an extra 10 minutes. Two people loved it and two others thought that it was too rich. I think next time Ill put a cup of chocolate chips in instead of a cup and a half and then bake it more. If I did that it would of been perfect. Still, I enjoyed the cake. I made a 9 inch layer cake with vanilla buttercream frosting. The cake needs a lot of frosting so it may be important to double some recipes. Pairs well with ice cream.
